DOC.HEADLINE: Nalbandian not to play in Shanghai Masters

TEXT.P: Argentine tennis player David Nalbandian said Thursday he would not play at the Tokyo Open and the Shanghai Masters in order to keep optimum conditions for the indoor stage of 2011 in Europe.
Nalbandian's spokesman Bernardo Ballero told Xinhua that Nalbandian "is not happy for not going to Shanghai because he won there the most important success: the Masters in 2005."
The Tokyo Open begins on Monday and the Shanghai Masters begins on Oct. 10, while the circuit games in Stockholm, Sweden, starts on Oct. 18.
